channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Tech Stocks Lift S&P 500 Amid US-China Trade Talks: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street investors glued to their screens amid trade talks between the US and China drove stocks mildly higher, adding to an advance that put the S&P 500 within a striking distance of its record.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Global Market Strategist Anna Rathbun discusses the impact of a rare earths deal between the U.S. and China, and how the feud between Elon Musk and President Trump shook up Tesla shares. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.”

item.title: Bitcoin’s Rally Means All of Strategy’s Purchases Are Profitable
item.description: The mini rally in Bitcoin over the past few trading sessions has made every purchase of the cryptocurrency by Michael Saylor’s Strategy over the last four plus years profitable.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: JPMorgan Lifts 2025 Muni-Bond Sales Forecast to $560 Billion
item.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised its forecast for 2025 municipal bond issuance by 14% as state and local governments step up borrowing efforts.
item.dc:creator: Arvelisse Bonilla Ramos

media:content.media:description: Road work signage in Los Angeles, California, US, on Tuesday, July 2, 2024. A surge in borrowing pushed municipal deal flow to the fastest start to the year on record after states and cities seized on more stable interest rates to flood the market.

item.title: Tesla’s Retail Army Defies Musk-Trump Spat to Place Record ETF Bet
item.description: As Elon Musk’s fortune plunged by $36 billion last week and Tesla Inc.’s stock suffered a brutal drubbing, his most ardent backers rushed in to buy the dip — with leverage.
item.dc:creator: Vildana Hajric

media:content.media:description: Vehicles at a Tesla store in Vallejo, California.

item.title: A Disturbing Reversal in the Real Price of Eggs
item.description: Progress going backwards
item.dc:creator: Joe Weisenthal, Tracy Alloway

media:content.media:description: Eggs for sale at Eastern Market in Detroit, Michigan, US, on Saturday, June 7, 2025. The Bureau of Labor Statistics is scheduled to release US consumer price index (CPI) figures on June 11. Photographer: Emily Elconin/Bloomberg

item.title: Bloomberg Surveillance 6/9/2025
item.description: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Credit Investors Embrace Portfolio Trades as ETF Grip Eases
item.description: Investors looking to move big blocks of corporate bonds have long relied on exchange-traded funds listed on stock exchanges to jump in and out of positions. But now, they’re increasingly trading directly in the debt market.
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Lee, Caleb Mutua, Lu Wang

item.title: 'Diversity Drives Meritocracy' Says Helena Morrissey
item.description: US President Donald Trump has sought to abolish diversity, equity and inclusion policies, with America's influence being felt in corporate environments worldwide. A new piece of research from the UK's Diversity Project makes the case for cognitive diversity to boost the performance of investment teams -- if they are well managed. Chair of Diversity Project and former CEO of Newton investment management Helena Morrissey spoke to Bloomberg's Caroline Hepker and Jack Sidders about if diversity actually does deliver better returns. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Platinum Extends Surge to Highest Since 2021 as Market Tightens
item.description: Platinum extended its surge as the market for the precious metal strains under signs of severe tightness.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan, Yvonne Yue Li

item.title: Gold-Dealing Banks Reaped $500 Million as Tariff Panic Set In
item.description: Precious metals traders at top banks including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley posted their best performance in five years in the first quarter, in part thanks to an arbitrage opportunity that sparked a rush of bullion into the US.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan, William Shaw

media:content.media:description: Gold granules are poured into molds for gold bars.

item.title: Oil Edges Up as Traders Await Outcome of US-China Trade Talks
item.description: Oil extended last week’s gain as a renewed round of US-China trade talks offered the potential for reduced global tensions.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Alex Longley

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery to Become Two Public Companies
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery is splitting into two publicly traded companies: one with HBO Max, film, and TV business, and the other with its cable business. Geetha Ranganathan has more on “Bloomberg Open Interest.”

item.title: Clearlake Hires Lederman from KKR as Head of Capital Markets
item.description: Clearlake Capital Group hired Josh Lederman from KKR & Co. for the newly created role of head of capital markets, according to a spokesperson for the firm.
item.dc:creator: Davide Scigliuzzo

item.title: Pump.Fun’s $1 Billion Token Sale Raises Liquidity Concerns for Memecoin Universe
item.description: Pump.fun’s decision to raise $1 billion is sparking concern that a token sale by the most popular platform for creating memecoins risks siphoning demand away from the hundreds of coins issued daily through the website.
item.dc:creator: Muyao Shen

item.title: What to Expect From Apple WWDC
item.description: Apple Inc.’s Worldwide Developers Conference will focus on design and productivity enhancements for its long-established operating system franchises with little to assuage fears that the iPhone maker is a laggard in AI. Caroline Hyde has a preview on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: US Stocks Fluctuate as US-China Trade Talks Kick Off in London
item.description: US stocks flipped between small gains and losses on Monday as investors awaited the outcome of crucial trade talks between Washington and Beijing in London.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Australia to Shorten IPO Process by a Week to Attract Listings
item.description: The Australian Securities Investment Commission will begin testing a more streamlined process for local initial public offerings to encourage more companies to list in the country.
item.dc:creator: Paul-Alain Hunt

item.title: US to Focus on Easing Export Controls From China
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick are leading a US delegation in trade talks with China in London. The US has signaled it's willing to remove export restrictions in exchange for China easing limits on rare earth shipments. Bloomberg's Annmarie Hordern is in London with the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sunnova Files for Bankruptcy Amid Rooftop Solar Struggles
item.description: Sunnova Energy International Inc., one of the largest US rooftop solar companies, filed for bankruptcy following struggles with mounting debt and diminishing sales prospects.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak

item.title: Five Key Charts to Watch in Global Commodity Markets
item.description: Oil watchers who have been anticipating a glut now have the numbers to back it up as global inventories climb. The world is spending billions for power infrastructure to meet soaring demand — and that’s going to need a lot of engineers. China hosts the world’s biggest solar convention this week where the mood might be gloomy. And silver is shining brighter.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan, Josh Saul, Alex Longley

item.title: Japan’s Taiyo Oil Imports Russian Crude on Sanctioned Tanker
item.description: The Japanese oil refiner Taiyo Oil Co. is taking delivery of a cargo of Russian crude on a tanker that’s blacklisted by both the US Treasury and the European Union.
item.dc:creator: Julian Lee, Tsuyoshi Inajima

media:content.media:description: The US-sanctioned oil tanker Voyager carries a cargo of crude from Russia’s Sakhalin 2 project to Japan.

item.title: Japanese Investors Offload Most German Bonds Since 2014
item.description: Japanese investors sold the largest amount of German government bonds in a decade in April as the securities rebounded from a selloff the previous month spurred by fiscal concerns.
item.dc:creator: Masaki Kondo

item.title: Ontario Drops American Banks From US-Dollar Bond Sale in First Since 2011
item.description: Ontario left American banks out of a US-dollar bond sale for the first time in almost 14 years, choosing Barclays Plc as its foreign bank to help manage a $2 billion debt issue.
item.dc:creator: Chunzi Xu

media:content.media:description: Doug Ford, Ontario's premier, at a rally during Ontario's provincial election in Etobicoke, Ontario, Canada, on Thursday, Feb. 27, 2025. Ford won a third straight election to lead Ontario, as voters in Canada's manufacturing heartland opted for a familiar face to steer an economy that's under threat from US President Donald Trump's trade policy.

item.title: India’s RBI to End Daily Fund Infusions Following Stance Shift
item.description: India’s central bank said it will stop daily fund injections into the financial system, days after the monetary authority shifted its policy stance and said the space for future easing was constrained.
item.dc:creator: Bhaskar Dutta

media:content.media:description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) headquarters building in Mumbai, India, on Friday, April 5, 2024. India's central bank stuck to its hawkish policy tone Friday as warnings of a coming heat wave renewed fears of an inflation spike. Photographer: Dhiraj Singh/Bloomberg

item.title: Tesla Hit With a Pair of Downgrades Amid Fallout From Trump Feud
item.description: Tesla Inc. was hit with a pair of downgrades on Monday, underscoring mounting concerns on Wall Street about the electric-vehicle maker’s outlook following last week’s clash between Chief Executive Elon Musk and President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: US Treasuries Win Some Respite as Key 30-Year Auction Looms
item.description: US Treasuries were trimming overnight gains, with modest weakness in longer dated debt as investors awaited a Thursday auction of 30-year securities that will offer a fresh test of demand for the beleaguered securities.
item.dc:creator: Alice Gledhill, Sujata Rao

item.title: BofA Sees Saudis Embarking on Long But Shallow Oil-Price War
item.description: OPEC+’s oil-output hikes are part of a Saudi strategy that will see the kingdom embark on a long but shallow price war designed to recapture market share, Bank of America Corp.’s head of commodities research said.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley

item.title: ESG Funds Outperform S&P 500 for Longest Stretch Since Late 2022
item.description: ESG-focused funds are beating the performance of the S&P 500 Index for the longest period since late 2022.
item.dc:creator: Tim Quinson

item.title: Gold Needs Shock for Price to Break Away: BofA’s Blanch
item.description: Francisco Blanch, head of commodities and derivatives research at BofA Securities, offers his outlook for gold and other precious metals as he has a $4,000 price target for gold, “which may be a 2026 story.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BofA’s Blanch Sees ‘Long and Shallow’ Oil Price War
item.description: Francisco Blanch, head of commodities and derivatives research at BofA Securities, examines OPEC’s strategy on pricing and supplies as he says $90 oil and six million barrels per day of exports was “not working.” (Source: Bloomberg)
